title: Starlink muddies itself with unscrupulous Zimbabwe President deal
creator: Luis Monzon
description: Alleged corruption is how Starlink received its approval to operate in Zimbabwe, according to several reports.The post Starlink muddies itself with unscrupulous Zimbabwe President deal appeared first on Hypertext.
content: Starlink has been given the go-ahead to operate in Zimbabwe by its president, Emerson Mnangagwa. A report alleges that Mnangagwa side-stepped regulatory approval to launch Starlink in the country. The company that will be Starlink’s “sole and exclusive” partner in Zimbabwe is owned by one of Mnangagwa’s close friends. There are now eight African nations that offer Starlink to customers as Zimbabwe’s President Emerson Mnangagwa fast-tracked a deal that sees the Elon Musk-owned satellite internet provider launch in the country via IMC Communications. IMC Communications is a local Zimbabwean company owned by Wicknell Chivayo. Several publications have reported that the country’s telecom regulator the Postal and Telecommunications Regulatory Authority (POTRAZ) has licensed Starlink to operate in Zimbabwe, as per Mnangagwa’s announcement. “I’m pleased to announce that I have approved the licensing of Starlink by POTRAZ to provide advanced internet and related digital processing services in Zimbabwe through its sole and exclusive partner, IMC Communications (Pvt) Ltd,” wrote Mnangagwa on X. A report from The Zimbabwean alleges that this claim is untrue, and in fact, POTRAZ is still deliberating on licensing Starlink in the Southern African nation. Not only that, but sources within POTRAZ expressed surprise to the publication that the president made the announcement without receiving the go-ahead from the regulator. “We at POTRAZ are still deliberating on Starlink,” a source told The Zimbabwean, adding that the application for Starlink to enter the country was “highly technical and requires meticulous analysis.” “We need to be confident that Starlink has given us all the key information and data before we can make a decision. That is why it is taking long to make a decision,” another source at POTRAZ said. POTRAZ is now apparently concerned that the approval for Starlink to launch in the country was given via social media, while it should have gone through all the formal processes before licensing and launching. In a South African context, this would have been like if President Cyril Ramaphosa had side-stepped ICASA’s many regulatory policies and approved Starlink to operate locally. Also, if Ramaphosa had made one of his companies Starlink’s “sole and exclusive” partner as it is alleged that Wicknell Chivayo is a close friend of Mnangagwa. According to TechZim , Chivayo’s company, IMC Communication, doesn’t even have a functional website yet was awarded the Starlink partnership without any formal processes. “There is a lot more on this website to suggest that it was hurriedly constructed to be up in time for today’s announcement,” the publication writes. Adding that some links are broken, and others lead to placeholder text. Clicking on ‘broadband’ or ‘satellite tv’ leads you to the generic ‘Hello WPHix’ page. We checked the website out , and it looks like a generic template, purported to be from a firm called “Etudes Architecture” which is a placeholder name. We also can’t find any offers to subscribe to Starlink at all. TechZim says that IMC is offering the Starlink kit for $650 (US), and there are three tiers of subscriptions: $38 a month for 50Mbps, $45 for 100Mbps and $85 for 1000Mbps. A World Bank report from 2021 suggests that only around 35 percent of Zimbabweans have access to the internet, so hopefully the availability of Starlink kits will aid those even in the most rural areas, despite the dodgy situation around its launch. [Image – Photo by Mariia Shalabaieva on Unsplash ]

title: Isle of Wight death and funeral notices in the County Press
description: The Isle Of Wight County Press published 25 death notices last week.
content: The Isle Of Wight County Press published 25 death notices last week. Every week, the County Press publishes death notices and funeral announcements from the families of loved ones who have passed away. As well as appearing in print, our death notice pages will remain online as a lasting tribute to the memory of those we have lost. Anyone who wishes to send their own message of condolence can do so by visiting the deceased's death notice page. title: Spain's PM says Cabinet to recognize a Palestinian state as EU rift with Israel widens
creator: Naharnet Newsdesk
description: Spain moved to formally recognize a Palestinian state with Ireland and Norway to follow suit on Tuesday in a coordinated effort by the three western European nations. Israel slammed the diplomatic move that will have no immediate impact on its grinding war in Gaza but adds to international pressure on Tel Aviv to soften its devastating response to last year's Hamas-led attack. Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez said the Spanish Cabinet will recognize a Palestinian state at its Tuesday morning meeting as a European Union rift with Israel widens. Ireland and Norway were also to make official their recognition of a Palestinian state later in the day.
content: Spain moved to formally recognize a Palestinian state with Ireland and Norway to follow suit on Tuesday in a coordinated effort by the three western European nations. Israel slammed the diplomatic move that will have no immediate impact on its grinding war in Gaza but adds to international pressure on Tel Aviv to soften its devastating response to last year's Hamas-led attack. Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez said the Spanish Cabinet will recognize a Palestinian state at its Tuesday morning meeting as a European Union rift with Israel widens. Ireland and Norway were also to make official their recognition of a Palestinian state later in the day. "This is a historic decision that has a single goal, and that is to help Israelis and Palestinians achieve peace," Sánchez, standing at the gates of the prime minister's palace in Madrid, said during a televised speech. Israel's Foreign Minister Israel Katz lashed out at Spain on X, saying Sánchez's government was "being complicit in inciting genocide against Jews and war crimes." While dozens of countries have recognized a Palestinian state, none of the major Western powers has done so. Still, the adherence of three European countries to the group represents a victory for Palestinian efforts in the world of public opinion. Relations between the EU and Israel nosedived Monday, the eve of the diplomatic recognition EU members Ireland and Spain, with Madrid insisting that the EU should take action against Israel for its continued deadly attacks in southern Gaza's city of Rafah. Norway, which is not an EU member but often aligns its foreign policy with the bloc, handed diplomatic papers to the Palestinian government over the weekend ahead of its formal recognition of a Palestinian state. At the same time, the EU's foreign policy chief Josep Borrell threw his weight behind the International Criminal Court, whose prosecutor is seeking an arrest warrant against Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and others, including leaders of the Hamas militant group. The formal declaration and resulting diplomatic dispute come over seven months into a grinding war waged by Israel against Hamas in Gaza following the Oct. 7 Hamas-led attack in which militants stormed across the Gaza border into Israel, killing 1,200 people and taking some 250 hostage. Israel's air and land attacks have killed 36,000 Palestinians, according to Gaza's Health Ministry, which does not distinguish between combatants and civilians. Last week's joint announcement by Spain, Ireland and Norway triggered an angry response from Israeli authorities, which summoned the countries' ambassadors in Tel Aviv to the Foreign Ministry, where they were filmed while being shown videos of the Oct. 7 Hamas attack and abductions. Some 140 countries — more than two-thirds of the United Nations — recognize a Palestinian state. The addition of three western European countries to that group will likely put pressure on EU heavyweights France and Germany to think hard about their continued refusal to follow suit. The United States and Britain, among others, back the idea of an independent Palestinian state alongside Israel but say it should come as part of a negotiated settlement. Netanyahu's government says the conflict can only be resolved through direct negotiations. In his speech on Tuesday, Sánchez said that the recognition of a Palestinian state was "a decision that we do not adopt against anyone, least of all against Israel, a friendly people whom we respect, whom we appreciate and with whom we want to have the best possible relationship." The Socialist leader, who announced his country's decision before parliament last week, has spent months touring European and Middle Eastern countries to garner support for recognition and a cease-fire in Gaza. He called for a permanent cease-fire, for stepping up humanitarian aid into Gaza and for the release of hostages that Hamas has held since the Oct. 7 attack that triggered Israel's response. Sánchez said that the move was to back the beleaguered Palestinian Authority, which lost effective political control of Gaza to Hamas. He laid out his vision for a state ruled by the Palestinian Authority that must connect the West Bank and Gaza via a corridor with east Jerusalem as its capital. The Western-backed Palestinian Authority administers parts of the Israeli-occupied West Bank, cooperates with Israel on security matters and favors a negotiated two-state solution. Its forces were driven out of Gaza by Hamas when the militants seized power there in 2007. The Palestinians have long sought an independent state in Gaza, the West Bank and east Jerusalem, territories Israel captured in the 1967 Mideast war. The idea of a land corridor linking Gaza and the West Bank through Israel was discussed in previous rounds of peace talks, but no serious or substantive peace negotiations have been held in over 15 years. "We will not recognize changes in the 1967 border lines other than those agreed to by the parties," Sánchez added. "Furthermore, this decision reflects our absolute rejection of Hamas, a terrorist organization who is against the two-state solution," Sánchez said. "From the outset, Spain has strongly condemned the terrorist attacks of Oct. 7. This clear condemnation is the resounding expression of our steadfast commitment in the fight against terrorism. I would like to underline that starting tomorrow we would focus all our efforts to implement the two state solution and make it a reality." Israel is also under pressure from the International Criminal Court after its chief prosecutor said he would seek arrest warrants for Netanyahu and his defense minister. The ICJ is also considering allegations of genocide that Israel has strenuously denied.

title: Zee Sets ‘Dhadak 2’ for November Theatrical Release – Global Bulletin
creator: Patrick Frater
description: ROMANTIC REUNION India’s Zee Studios has set a late November theatrical release for “Dhadak 2,” a romance film challenging societal norms. The film is a sequel to 2016 hit “Dhadak,” that was itself a Hindi remake of the Marathi film “Sairat.” The 2016 title starred Ishaan Khatter and Janhvi Kapoor, as well as the late [...]
content: India’s Zee Studios has set a late November theatrical release for “ Dhadak 2 ,” a romance film challenging societal norms. The film is a sequel to 2016 hit “Dhadak,” that was itself a Hindi remake of the Marathi film “Sairat.” The 2016 title starred Ishaan Khatter and Janhvi Kapoor, as well as the late Sridevi. The new film is directed by Shazia Iqbal and stars Siddhant Chaturvedi and Triptii Dimri in lead roles. Plot details were scarce, though Zee teased it with the logline: [the film] “explores barriers of class and status stitched in the minds of societies, underscoring a narrative of love that can never be fulfilled. Or can it?” Production is by Zee Studios, Karan Johar’s Dharma Productions , and Cloud 9 Pictures and is slated for release on Nov. 22, 2024, a slot that falls neatly between Diwali and Christmas. Watch the teaser here: Production is set to start imminently in Australia on “The Bluff,” a 19th-century-set film about a female pirate who must protect her family as the consequences of her past catch up with her. It stars Priyanka Chopra Jonas and Karl Urban and is being produced by AGBO for Amazon’s Prime Video service. The Bluff’ is set to be directed by Frank E. Flowers , who also co-wrote the screenplay with Joe Ballarini. The producers include Chopra Jonas, AGBO’s Anthony Russo, Joe Russo , Angela Russo-Otstot and Michael Disco, Cinestar Pictures’ Cisely Saldana and Mariel Saldana. ‘The Bluff’ is the second collaboration between Chopra-Jonas, AGBO and Amazon MGM Studios, following the multinational crime action series “Citadel.” Chopra Jonas posted Instagram pictures of herself and her daughter arriving Down Under for the start of production. Australia’s Sharmill Films is to give a theatrical release to “The Seed of the Sacred Fig,” the Cannes Special Award- and FIPRESCI Award-winning film by Iran’s Mohammad Rasoulof . The director was not permitted to leave his home country, but did so anyway to attend the Cannes Film Festival premiere of his picture.

title: Is there a business case for Adani’s UPI, e-commerce foray?
creator: Kartik Malhotra
description: The Gautam Adani run empire is looking at applying for a payments licence for UPI transactions that will enable it to compete with the likes of Walmart-backed PhonePe and Alphabet’s Google Pay that together command a lion’s share of India’s digital market.
content: The Gautam Adani run empire is looking at applying for a payments licence for UPI transactions that will enable it to compete with the likes of Walmart-backed PhonePe and Alphabet’s Google Pay that together command a lion’s share of India’s digital market. If you think of Adani Group as primarily a B2B conglomerate – think again. Adani’s consumer focus is getting sharper and its touchpoints with us – the consumers –getting wider, and deeper. For one... there is Adani Wilmar – an FMCG player; then there are airports and lounges run by Adani; Adani Power that powers up houses... and there’s the Adani-owned NDTV ... all operating at the cusp of direct to customer. Fresh reports suggest that Adani Group’s latest forays will challenge the big boys of digital payments as well as ecommerce. That’s right. India’s highly competitive digital payments space as well as the ever-growing ecommerce sector is likely to get one more player in Adani Group. The Gautam Adani run empire is looking at applying for a payments licence for UPI transactions that will enable it to compete with the likes of Walmart-backed PhonePe and Alphabet’s Google Pay that together command a lion’s share of India’s digital market. This as per a Financial Times report. Adani Group is yet to confirm the newsbreak. The report also says that Adani Group will enter the ecommerce space by integrating ONDC or the Open Network for Digital Commerce into its Adani One app that it launched in December 2022, a month before the Hindenburg Research allegations surfaced. Adani Group will reportedly also launch a co-branded credit card that will reward users of all Adani services like electricity bills or airport shopping. So let’s take this one by one and see if Adani Group’s digital economy foray makes business sense. The UPI space in India is ballooning. We’re talking hundreds of billions here. India recorded about 131 billion UPI transactions last financial year. 131 billion transactions averages to every Indian popping out that smartphone and transacting over 150 times a year or practically every second day. And the total volume of UPI transactions last year was about ₹200 trillion – or 200 lakh crore rupees! But UPI apps make very little money. Just a 1.1% commission only on transactions over ₹2,000. So in effect, all transactions under ₹2,000 make no money for the UPI service provider. So does it make sense for Adani Group to enter a business that doesn’t make tons of money? It sure doesn’t sound like Gautam Adani. A quick look at which UPI apps India uses. Walmart-backed PhonePe and Alphabet-backed Google Pay together command 86% of India’s UPI space. The rest is split between Paytm, BharatPe, Cred and other such. So, the question is – even if Adani Group eyes the UPI space will it build from scratch of buy out a smaller potential rival? Remember, Paytm which was hit hard by RBI in Jan this year continues to operate as a third-party payment app. Now let’s move to the ecommerce play. Adani Group had launched Adani One in December 2022. It has so far been narrowly focused on travel services like booking flight tickets, train tickets, hotel rooms, and cabs to and from the airport. The Financial Times report says Adani Group will now integrate ONDC on Adani One and play the full ecommerce game. Remember Tata Group tried a super app Tata Neu and could not compete in the ecommerce market. Reliance Ajio on the other hand quickly gained ground. The question for Adani however is – with a crowded space dominated by global players like Amazon as well as Walmart-owned Flipkart, plus domestic players like Reliance Ajio – all in the backdrop of many not so successful upstarts including Snapdeal and Shopclues – will Adani One, which, in the travel space already faces competition from MakeMyTrip, EaseMyTrip, Booking.com etc – be able to make a dent in the full ecommerce play? Industry analysts say if Adani jumps into a new business, at least a big splash can be expected. But eventually if will boil down to how much and how long one stays invested in a new business idea. Gautam Adani sure has the pockets, but does he have the D2C appetite? We’ll have to find out.

title: Malaysia Airlines MH370: Enigmatic mystery comes to end or another chapter in continued fascination?
creator: Akshit Joshi
description: From Australia to China, private US companies to other non-governmental organisations and individuals, the search for MH370 became a global obsession
content: From Australia to China, private US companies to other non-governmental organisations and individuals, the search for MH370 became a global obsession New Delhi: One of the most enduring mysteries captivating mass consciousness for around a decade now has been the disappearance of the Malaysia Airlines flight, MH370. While flying over the South China Sea, the aeroplane mysteriously disappeared from radar screens. Since then it has become a topic of fascination as a modern enigma which has been surrounded by numerous conspiracy theories, conjectures and attempts at discovery. It is again in the news after an expert has made a claim that he ‘found’ the MH370 plane deep inside the Cambodian jungle using Google Maps. The news of another claim of finding the plane, while yet officially unsubstantiated, has again led the world to be caught by the MH370 fascination bug and the internet is ablaze. Story of the plane’s disappearance Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 was an international passenger flight operated by Malaysia Airlines that disappeared from radar on 8 March 2014. It was flying from Kuala Lumpur International Airport in Malaysia to Beijing Capital International Airport in China before its disappearance. The causes of its disappearance and where it went have still not been determined. The crew of the aeroplane last communicated with air traffic control around 38 minutes after takeoff. The craft was flying over the South China Sea at that time. The aircraft’s final transmission was an automated position report which indicated that the aircraft was flying at its assigned cruise altitude of flight level 350. It lost touch with the surveillance radar screens minutes later but was tracked by the Malaysian military’s primary radar system for another hour, deviating westward from its planned flight path. With all 227 passengers and 12 crew aboard presumed dead, the search for the missing aeroplane became the most expensive search in the history of aviation but the Malaysian Ministry of Transport’s final report from July 2018 was inconclusive. Mystery has world obsess over answer After the plane’s disappearance, multinational search efforts began in the Gulf of Thailand and the South China Sea. These were later extended to the Strait of Malacca and Andaman Sea. From Australia to China, private US companies to other non-governmental organisations and individuals, the search for MH370 became a global obsession. The aircraft’s crew did not relay any distress signal before its disappearance. Neither there were indications of bad weather nor any prior technical difficulties were reported, so theories have abounded over what happened to the flight. The disappearance of Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 has been described as “one of the biggest mysteries in modern aviation history”. Our fascination with it has been extreme and we have not been able to let go with finding an answer. Several documentaries have been produced on its disappearance, from the Smithsonian Channel to the Discovery Channel Broadcast and a three-part Netflix docuseries, MH370: The Plane That Disappeared, on the ninth anniversary of the flight’s disappearance. While many reasons can be given as to why our near-obsession with finding the truth about MH370 remains, some aspects of this remain inexplicable. Mysteries such as these have often catered to segments of society which feed off hidden truths and conspiracies theories. Many such incidents have existed and while the general public forgets about them, some are forever stuck finding answers. Currently, the case with MH370 though seems to be different. It has been able to hold the world’s attention for so long and this is not certain restricted to just isolated segments of conspiracy theorists. A major reason that can account for this is that after the plane’s disappearance, the search event became a global effort. A large number of countries came together and pitched in their efforts to find any clues about what happened to the plane. This large concentrated effort also makes it hard for everyone to let go of finding an answer. The internet age also contributed in making the plane’s disappearance a globally known phenomenon whose details were on the internet for everyone to know. This aided by internet fueled conspiracy theories have also made it hard for the story to be erased from the public consciousness. While the current news of the find using Google Maps has not been officially verified, it just goes on to show that the mystery will remain to haunt us and we as a global community are not letting go of it anytime soon. (Disclaimer: The views expressed in this article are those of the author alone. The opinions and facts in this article do not represent the stand of News9.)

title: Rowdy teens ruining the Jersey Shore — NJ Top News
keywords: new jersey's first news with eric scott
creator: Eric Scott
description: Chaos kicked off the summer of 2024 at the Jersey Shore. Local mayors have had enough of rowdy teens running rampant. Eric Scott has details on this morning's First News. Continue reading...
content: Here are the top New Jersey news stories for Tuesday: ⬛ Are you ready, NJ? REAL ID deadline is getting closer It's looking like this enforcement date will actually stick. We're less than a year out from the date on which the federal government will stop accepting your standard driver license or state-issued identification as proper documentation when you want to board a domestic flight or enter a federal facility. Starting May 7, 2025, a REAL ID will be the only type of license accepted. ⬛ NJ woman charged in 12-year-old girl's tragic fatal overdose FORT LEE — A Bergen County woman has been arrested after the death of a 12-year-old girl this weekend. Frances Caso, 48, of Fort Lee was charged with one count of second-degree child endangerment, three counts of third-degree child endangerment, two counts of third-degree drug possession, and fourth-degree drug paraphernalia possession. She is being held at Bergen County Jail pending a court appearance, according to Bergen County prosecutors. ⬛ Weekend deaths of 2 children at NJ homes under investigation NORTH BRUNSWICK — The deaths of two children in New Jersey that both happened on Saturday are under investigation. A 4-year-old boy tragically drowned in a pool at a North Brunswick home on Saturday, according to Middlesex County Prosecutor Yolanda Ciccone. Police were called to the home around 7:45 p.m. after a child was found in the pool. The caller said the child wasn't breathing. ⬛ Jersey Shore chaos: Fights, false shooter kick off Memorial Day SEASIDE HEIGHTS — Videos of crowds running from fights and possible gunshots at the Jersey Shore are flooding social media to start the summer. Armed police officers were seen responding to the Seaside Heights boardwalk in videos posted to Facebook. And on X, footage showed another angle of the boardwalk where people were fleeing the area. Mayor Tony Vaz said the panic spread throughout the largest crowds he's ever seen at the boardwalk after fake reports of a shooter. ⬛ Cops made hundreds of arrests at these NJ schools Police are putting fewer students in handcuffs at New Jersey schools despite an increase in violence and drug use. Districts reported 632 arrests at 245 schools during the 2022-2023 school year, according to a New Jersey 101.5 analysis of data released this year by the state Department of Education. How to spot a Benny or Shoobie at the NJ Shore A fun take on knowing who is who at the New Jersey Shore. Gallery Credit: Mike Brant Sights and sounds of rural New Jersey Gallery Credit: Kyle Clark Here is where all “The Real Housewives of New Jersey” live For Seasons 14 and 13 of the show, the Real Housewives of New Jersey hometowns are largely in North Jersey — with a Central Jersey resident and some Shore houses, for good measure. Gallery Credit: Erin Vogt Start your day with up-to-the-minute news, traffic and weather for the Garden State. New Jersey's First News with Eric Scott is the longest running news program in New Jersey. Eric Scott began hosting the program in 1991. It airs live on New Jersey 101.5 each weekday morning from 5:30 - 6 a.m. New Jersey's First News with Eric Scott is the winner of the prestigious National Edward R. Murrow Award for Best Newscast. Eric Scott is the senior political director and anchor for New Jersey 101.5. You can reach him at eric.scott@townsquaremedia.com Click here to contact an editor about feedback or a correction for this story.

title: Neta L’s electric variant now available to pre-order in China
creator: Sagar Parikh
description: Chinese automaker Hozon Auto has started taking pre-orders for the Neta L’s pure electric variant in its home market. The new electric SUV’s pre-sale prices fall between 129,900 and 159,900 yuan (approx. €16,800-€20,700), depending on the trim.
content: The Neta L is available in three purely electric variants. The official market launch is scheduled for the end of June, with deliveries starting in July. , the carmaker already presented four equipment variants of the Neta L EREV (Extended Range Electric Vehicle) with a price range of 129,900 to 159,900 yuan. At 4,770 mm long, 1,900 mm wide, and 1,660 mm tall, the Neta L electric is a mid-size SUV. It’s a five-seater model with a 2,810 mm wheelbase, and it offers 583 litres of luggage space, which can be increased to 1,434 litres by folding the second-row seat. Select configurations even include a frunk with an additional 67-litre storage space. Based on the indigenously developed ‘Shanhai’ platform, the Neta L is available as a range-extender EV and also a fully electric vehicle. The latter employs a single permanent magnet synchronous motor (PMSM) in the rear across the range. This motor produces 170 kW (231 PS) and 310 Nm of torque, letting the EV hit 0 to 100 kph in 7.6 seconds and achieve a top speed of 180 kph. The Neta L EV features cell-to-body (CTB) technology, in which the battery cells are part of the vehicle body, enhancing stability and safety. CATL’s Shenxing LFP battery cells are standard in the electric SUV, and they give it 68 kWh of energy storage capacity, allowing it to cover a distance of 510 km on a full charge, as per CLTC. These battery cells support ultra-fast charging, so increasing the charging level from 10 to 80% capacity takes as little as 21 minutes. On the outside, the Neta L packs features like dynamic turn signals (front and rear), electrically deploying flush-fitted door handles, a panoramic sunroof with electrically operated sunshade, and 19-inch alloy wheels wrapped in 225/55 R19 Michelin e.Primacy tyres. Inside, a widescreen digital instrument cluster, two 15.6-inch touchscreens (centre and passenger-side) combined in a single frame, a 64-colour ambient lighting system, and a refrigerator built into the centre console are some of the highlights of the new electric SUV. The Neta L offers great comfort in the front with a 10-way power-adjustable massage seat for the driver and a 14-way zero-gravity power-adjustable massage seat for the passenger. Both front seats include memory, ventilation, and heating functions, a wing-type headrest, and lumbar support as well. The front passenger seat features even leg support adjustment. Rear-seat passengers can enjoy heating and two-position (117°/122°) recline functions. The Neta L EV will launch on the domestic market at the end of June. Mass deliveries of the electric SUV in China will start in July. ,

title: Alef Education Unveils IPO Details, Subscription Period Kicks Off
creator: The Arabian Post Network
description: Arabian Post -Abu Dhabi-based education technology leader Alef Education announced the price range for its initial public offering (IPO) on the Abu Dhabi Securities Exchange (ADX) today. The company also revealed the commencement of the subscription period for potential investors. Alef Education set its offering price range between AED 1. 30 and AED 1. 35 per share. This translates to an expected market capitalization of between AED 9. 10 [...]via Alef Education Unveils IPO Details, Subscription Period Kicks Off
content: Abu Dhabi-based education technology leader Alef Education announced the price range for its initial public offering (IPO) on the Abu Dhabi Securities Exchange (ADX) today. The company also revealed the commencement of the subscription period for potential investors. Alef Education set its offering price range between AED 1. 30 and AED 1. 35 per share. This translates to an expected market capitalization of between AED 9. 10 billion (US$2. 48 billion) and AED 9. 45 billion (US$2. 57 billion) at the time of listing. The company will offer 1. 4 billion ordinary shares, representing 20% of its issued share capital. The total offering size is expected to range between AED 1. 82 billion (US$496 million) and AED 1. 89 billion (US$515 million). The proceeds from the IPO will not go to Alef Education itself, but rather to its existing shareholders, Tech Nova Investment and Kryptonite Investments. Alef Education, a provider of AI-powered learning solutions, boasts a strong track record in the UAE. The company serves all public schools in the Emirates and has a presence in a select number of international markets. It also has a long-term contract with the Abu Dhabi Department of Education and Knowledge (ADEK), guaranteeing fee collection for the next seven years. The subscription period for the IPO opened today, May 28th, 2024, and will close on June 4th for individual investors. Institutional investors will have an extra day, with their subscription period ending on June 5th. The final offer price is expected to be determined after the book-building process concludes. Following the IPO, Alef Education has pledged to distribute a minimum dividend of AED 135 million for each of its financial years ending December 31, 2024 and 2025 to all shareholders excluding the selling shareholders. This translates to a projected dividend yield of approximately 7. 42% at the top of the price range and 7. 14% at the lower end. If Alef Education successfully completes its IPO, it will be the first education technology company to list on a UAE exchange. The offering is seen as a significant development for the UAE's growing technology sector and education reform efforts.

title: Babar Azam 51 runs away from breaking Virat Kohli’s world record ahead of 3rd T20I against England
creator: Abhishek Kumar
description: Pakistan captain Babar Azam is on the cusp of breaking a world record held by Virat Kohli in the 3rd T20I between Pakistan and England on Tuesday.
content: Pakistan captain Babar Azam is on the cusp of breaking a world record held by Virat Kohli in the 3rd T20I between Pakistan and England on Tuesday. New Delhi: Pakistan captain Babar Azam is on the verge of breaking a world record held by Team India star Virat Kohli in the upcoming third T20I against England on Tuesday, May 28. Pakistan will lock horns with England in the third T20I of the ongoing 4-match series between the two sides at Sophia Gardens in Cardiff. Pakistan will be looking to bounce back to winning ways to keep the series alive after a 23-run defeat in the 2nd T20I. While the first T20I was washed out due to rain, England successfully defended the total of 183 runs in the second T20I to go 1-0 up in the three-match series. The hosts rode on captain Jos Buttler’s brilliant knock of 84 runs to post a strong total on the board before their bowlers produced an excellent effort to bundle out Pakistan for 160 runs and wrap up a dominant win. Babar was the second-highest run-getter for Pakistan in the 2nd T20I as he ended up scoring 32 off 26 balls. However, the Pakistan skipper failed to notch up a big knock to take his team home. Babar is now on the verge of breaking an all-time record held by Kohli and will be looking to achieve the elusive feat during the third T20I in Cardiff. Babar needs only 51 runs to surpass Kohli in becoming the leading run-getter of all time in T20Is. Kohli has 4037 runs under his belt in 117 T20I matches for India whereas Babar has notched up 3987 runs for Pakistan in 118 T20Is. If the Pakistan skipper manages to score 51 runs in the third T20I on Tuesday, he will overtake Kohli in the elite list. Most runs in T20Is: Virat Kohli – 4037 runs Babar Azam – 3987 runs Rohit Sharma – 3974 runs Even if he fails to notch up 51 runs in the third T20I, Babar needs only 13 more runs to become the first Pakistan batter and the second overall to complete 4,000 runs in the shortest format of the game. Babar has been one of the most prolific run-getters for Pakistan in T20Is ever since making his debut in the shortest format in 2016. Pakistan look to avoid series defeat against England After suffering a 23-run defeat in the second T20I, Pakistan will be looking to bounce back to avoid a series defeat against the hosts. With the first T20I getting washed out, a win in the third T20I will give England an unassailable lead of 2-0 in the four-match series. Pakistan batters will look to step up after their disappointing show in the 2nd T20I.

title: Lib Dems call for experts to sit on water company boards to improve transparency
description: Under the party’s plans, local environment experts within the community would sit on the water company boards as non-executive directors.
content: The Liberal Democrat Leader is set to outline his proposals to hold the water industry to account during a visit to the Lake District today. Under the party’s plans, local environment experts within the community would sit on the water company boards as non-executive directors to “improve public accountability and transparency”. The experts would also be expected to hold community meetings to report back on action being taken. In the run-up to the General Election, the Lib Dems have unveiled plans to abolish Ofwat and introduce a new water regulator to tackle the sewage crisis, in addition to banning water CEO bonuses. According to the Environment Agency, sewage spills into England’s rivers and seas more than doubled in 2023 with 3.6 million hours of spills last year – equal to about 400 years – compared with 1.75 million hours in 2022. Sir Ed said: “Water companies are getting away with this national sewage scandal whilst Conservative MPs and ministers have just sat on their hands. “These disgraced firms are destroying our treasured lakes and rivers with their filthy sewage dumping – hitting human health, harming our precious environment and damaging the local tourism economy all at the same time. “Enough is enough. It’s time to get tough on the water industry and a key part of that change must be new ways to hold these firms to account, putting power in the hands of the local communities suffering from this scandal. “Local environmental experts on company boards could hold water bosses’ feet to the fire and local people would finally have a say in how their water company is run. “Liberal Democrats will have the boldest manifesto plans to end the sewage scandal – from a tough new regulator to a ban on greedy exec bonuses to holding water bosses properly to account. “This election will be about saving our country’s precious environment for the next generation, not least in special places like the Lake District.” Sir Ed is visiting the Lake District, where protests have taken place outside the office of water company United Utilities, after it was accused of pumping sewage into Unesco protected lakes. According to Liberal Democrat analysis of Companies House records, United Utilities has made £2.3 billion in operating profits since 2019 and paid their top executives over £2 million in bonuses.

title: Choosing action over ballots: Pursuing real change in South Africa

creator: Adam Parry
description: The PSA is delighted to announce Liz Madden and Tom Rees have recently been elected as Co-Chairs of the Council. Both Liz and Tom have been active council members of the PSA for a long time and bring a wealth of knowledge to the role. Their joint goal is to increase direct support for members and further evolve industry [...]
content: Liz Madden commented: “We are looking forward to working with both council members and members to continue the growth and development of the PSA. The live industry faces ongoing challenges, and we will continue to provide support to members and the industry as a whole. Skills shortage is currently a key issue for the industry, and we are working on a training and education programme to address this.” Tom Rees added: “We find great value in our long-standing experience on the council. By sharing Chair responsibilities, a PSA first, we can more effectively navigate during industry busy periods and continue to drive the success of the PSA, which boasts over 2300 members and grow this further.” Rejoining Liz and Tom as Officers are Keith Wood as Treasurer and Dave Bigg as Vice Chair. The PSA would also like to extend gratitude to Dave Keighley for his years of dedicated service as Chair. His contributions have been invaluable, and we are thankful for all he has done for the association. Dave will remain part of the elected council.

title: 'To leave after first round was not an ideal return', says Nadal after shock Roland Garros exit
creator: The Hans India
description: It was an emotional evening at Court Philippe-Chatrier as the 'King of Clay' Rafael Nadal made a shocking first round exit from Roland Garros after losing to Alexander Zverev.
content: Paris: It was an emotional evening at Court Philippe-Chatrier as the 'King of Clay' Rafael Nadal made a shocking first round exit from Roland Garros after losing to Alexander Zverev. Nadal’s legacy of record 14 Roland Garros titles is a testament to his sheer quality and industry on clay. At 37, the Spaniard has an illustrious career in tennis to look back at, as he moves closer to retirement which seems imminent, considering his injuries. Even as Alexander Zverev claimed a straight sets victory over the Spaniard, hearts went out to Nadal who, might as well, played his last match of the Grand Slam ever. "It’s going to be the last time I’m here in front of all of you. I’m not 100% sure, but if it was the last time, then I must say I enjoyed it. The feelings that I have today are difficult to describe in words. For me, it was special to feel the love of the people in the place that I love the most," said Nadal while addressing the spectators in the stadium. "I have gone through very tough two years in terms of injuries. I went through that recovery process only to be back at Roland Garros. To leave after the first round was not an ideal return. But I have to accept it. I was competitive and I had my chances. But it was not enough against a great player like Sasha (Alexander Zverev)," he averred. He did give the spectators something to cheer for while mentioning a possible return to Court Philippe-Chatrier for the upcoming Paris 2024 Olympics. "What you all have made me feel here, it’s unforgettable. I hope to see you again. Merci Beaucoup!" he conlcuded.

title: Tools And Platforms For Your Day Trading Startup
creator: TI Partners
description: What is the hype behind day trading? Why is every other person talking about day trading? All we know is day trading means buying and selling financial instruments like stocks, currencies, futures, etc., but within a span of a single trading day. This is known to be the fastest way of trading but is considered [...]The post Tools And Platforms For Your Day Trading Startup appeared first on Tekedia.
content: What is the hype behind day trading? Why is every other person talking about day trading? All we know is day trading means buying and selling financial instruments like stocks, currencies, futures, etc., but within a span of a single trading day. This is known to be the fastest way of trading but is considered to be a potentially lucrative pursuit. It is not like a long-term investment, where you buy and hold the commodity till the time its price surges, and you sell it for a higher price. In this trading, you depend on the equipment (technology) you use to take a chance in the market in a timely manner. To make it simpler to understand, let’s give you an example of a Formula One racer racing in a rusty old car. Guess who will win the race? Obviously, the F1 guy. The old car racer needs a finely tuned engine to win the race, just the way a day trader needs an advanced set of tools and platforms to compete in the financial markets. For what purposes will the tools and platforms be beneficial for the traders? The technology you will use will help you with your day trading endeavors. It will help you access live market data, perform trades quickly and efficiently, analyze market trends, and identify opportunities. What Factors Add To The Success Of Day Trading? Let’s define a successful day trade before diving into the tools needed for successful day trading. A winning day trade involves entering and exiting a position within the same trading day, profiting from a price movement that aligns with your prediction. This can involve buying a stock at a low point and selling it later in the day at a higher price, or vice versa (short selling) if you anticipate the price to fall. To achieve consistent success in day trading, a deep understanding of the financial markets is paramount. This knowledge encompasses two key areas—understanding the market dynamics and technical analysis. Successful day traders develop a keen sense of how various factors influence market behavior. This includes economic data releases, company news events, geopolitical situations, and even investor sentiment. Technical analysis involves studying historical price charts and market indicators to identify potential trading opportunities. Day traders utilize various technical indicators like moving averages, RSI, and Bollinger Bands to gauge market momentum, support and resistance levels, and potential trend reversals. Knowledge alone isn’t enough. Successful day traders translate their market understanding into actionable trading strategies. These strategies outline specific entry and exit points for trades based on technical analysis and defined risk parameters. Here’s the crucial part: you don’t just develop a strategy and blindly follow it. Before risking real capital, successful day traders “backtest” their strategies using historical market data. This allows them to evaluate the strategy’s potential performance and identify any flaws before deploying it in live trading. The market environment is dynamic, and successful traders continuously refine their strategies based on experience and changing market conditions. Even with a deep understanding of the markets and a well-defined trading strategy, success in day trading hinges on two crucial factors—discipline and risk management. The fast-paced nature of day trading can be emotionally charged. Witnessing sudden price swings can trigger impulses to chase gains or panic-sell at a loss. However, successful day traders cultivate ironclad discipline. They adhere to their pre-defined trading plan, avoiding the temptation to deviate based on emotions. This means entering and exiting trades based on your strategy’s signals, not fleeting feelings of fear or greed. Risk management is the nail in the coffin of any successful day trading operation. Every trade carries inherent risk, and the key is to limit your potential losses. This is where stop-loss orders become essential. A stop-loss order is an automated instruction set with your agent to sell a security if the price reaches a predetermined level. By setting stop-loss orders on every trade, you establish a maximum amount you’re willing to lose on that particular position. While it might mean missing out on some potential profits, it prevents catastrophic losses that could wipe out your entire account. Successful day traders also utilize other risk management techniques, such as: What Are Some Essential Tools You Can Use For Day Trading? As we said earlier, one must equip themselves with the right resources to be a successful day trader. If you want to be well-equipped for day trading, follow our three-dimensional approach, which comprises reliable hardware, live market data feed, and a good trading platform. Let’s have a look at how these can help your day trading go from zero to millions or even billions. What do you perform trade with? A computer, so reliable computer hardware, means an engine of your trading machine. There are multiple checks to make to ensure that you have a reliable system to operate. To make the engine work, consider the following checklist: Just like a pilot needs real-time weather data to fly the plane safely, day traders depend on live market data to make good decisions. A good market data feed provides live quotes, breaking news, and market analysis. You need access to constantly updating stock prices, currency exchange rates, and other relevant market data. Some of the popular data feed providers are Bloomberg, Reuters, and IQ Feed. However, if you want to stay informed about market-moving news events further, you can gain valuable insights from technical analysis tools like Ethereum code offered by some data feed services. Do you know what a trading platform offers you other than currency exchange or commodities? Well, a trading platform acts like a central hub for executing trades. However, it further analyzes the markets and manages your portfolio on your behalf. Here is why you should consider a trading platform: You get access to the charting tools. The advanced charting capabilities will give you a detailed and effective technical analysis. You have to look for a platform that offers different chart types, technical indicators, and drawing tools to help you look for trading opportunities. Popular charting platforms like TradingView can be integrated with some brokers. To be successful in day trading you need a smooth way of order placement and execution. You must ensure your platform allows for various order types (market orders, limit orders, stop-loss orders) and fast order routing for swift trade execution. Some platforms offer built-in research tools like fundamental analysis reports, company news feeds, and earnings calendars, allowing you to make well-rounded trade decisions. Popular platforms with extensive research resources include TD Ameritrade’s Thinkorswim and Interactive Brokers’ TWS platform. Some Popular Day Trading Platforms Having explored the essential tools, let’s discuss the best day trading platforms. Choosing the right platform is crucial, as it directly impacts your trading experience and efficiency. Here’s a list of some popular options: Summing Up Equipping yourself with the right tools and platforms is an essential first step for aspiring day traders. Reliable hardware, real-time market data, and a well-featured trading platform form the foundation for informed decision-making and efficient order execution. Remember, the “perfect” platform doesn’t exist – it depends on your individual needs and trading style. Beyond the tools, consider supplementing your knowledge with educational resources and joining online communities of experienced day traders. Continuous learning and a supportive network can be invaluable assets on your day trading journey.

title: How your water bills could change if Ofwat stops firms hiking prices
creator: Joe Duggan
description: The industry regulator Ofwat is set to reject most water companies’ requests to increase consumer annual bills, it is claimed
content: Industry regulator Ofwat is set to reject most water companies’ requests to increase consumer bills, it has been reported. Ofwat is due to announce its draft decisions on its 2024 price review which will set the levels of service water customers can expect and the bills they will pay for 2025 to 2030. The announcement, which comes amid mounting public anger over water companies’ handling of sewage pollution, will also include a decision on Thames Water’s bill increase and spending plans. What have water firms asked for? Water firms in England and Wales have reportedly declared they want to increase bills by between 24 per cent and 91 per cent over the next five years, according to a consumer watchdog. That is despite sewage spills into England’s rivers a nd seas more than doubling in 2023. Southern Water is asking for the biggest increase of 91 per cent, which would mean its customers’ bills would rise from the current level of £479 to £915 per year, according to the Consumer Council for Water (CCW). South Staffordshire and Cambridge Water are requesting the lowest rise – of 24 per cent – which equates to a £43 rise in their bills. What is Ofwat expected to say? A hotly anticipated review of how expensive water bills could be over the coming years has been pushed back because of the general election Ofwat has delayed publication of its decision on pricing until 11 July from an original date of 12 June. The consultation will see Ofwat give its initial verdict on water companies’ business plans until the end of the decade, which it does every five years. But according to The Guardian , the regulator is poised to refuse most water companies’ requests to raise consumer bills, with some getting only half of what they want. The regulator says the new price controls set as part of its 2024 review will still come into effect on April 1 2025, despite the later publication date for its draft decisions. What does this mean for bills? It’s not yet clear which companies have had their requests turned down or how much of their proposed bill increases have been rejected. But according to The Guardian , Thames Water’s request to increase bills by 59 per cent to £749 a year have been rejected by Ofwat, with sources describing the firm’s business plans as “fag-packet figures” and a “microwave job”. They added that Thames Water’s board members were determined to “sit on a deckchair on the Titanic”. A Thames Water spokesperson said: “Ofwat has announced that its draft determination will be delayed until after the general election in July and so any comment about its content before that would be premature”. Why is Thames Water in trouble? The future of Britain’s biggest water firm, Thames Water , could hinge on the decision with the giant the most heavily indebted of England and Wales’ water companies. When the company was privatised in 1989, it had no debt, but has since borrowed heavily. Thames Water has a roughly £15 billion debt and, along with the other water companies, has become embroiled in a scandal over water pollution. It faces potential nationalisation after investors rowed back on a promise to provide extra funding, putting the company’s finances in the balance. Thames has asked Ofwat to allow it to hike customer bills over the next five years to help it invest in its infrastructure and balance the books. What about other utility bills? Households across England, Wales and Scotland are set to pay less on their energy bills from July after energy regular Ofgem has announced its quarterly price cap . Read Next How the 'triple lock plus' would affect your pension The average household energy bill is to fall by 7 per cent after Ofgem lowered its price cap in response to wholesale prices. The typical household’s energy bill is set to fall from the current £1,690 a year to £1,568. This will be £500 less than the cap in July last year, when it was £2,074, but Labour have pointed out it is still £400 more than in 2021. And analysts have warned the regulator could increase the price cap on bills in October. The Tories have said they would keep the energy price cap in every year of the next parliament and introduce improved customer service to help consumers find cheaper energy bills and drive up competition. Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer has said, if elected, a government led by him would set up Great British Energy, a new publicly owned energy company, which would “invest in homegrown clean energy to boost energy independence and cut bills for good”.

title: HONOR 200 series is official with 100W charging & much more
keywords: all the latest android & tech news
creator: Kristijan Lucic
description: HONOR has announced two new smartphones, the HONOR 200 series. The devices that were announced are the HONOR 200 and HONOR 200 Pro. HONOR announced the two phones in China, as this is their initial launch. Both are expected to launch globally too, though. The HONOR 200 series is official, and the phones are coming [...]Read More... from HONOR 200 series is official with 100W charging & much moreThe post HONOR 200 series is official with 100W charging & much more appeared first on Android Headlines.
content: HONOR has announced two new smartphones , the HONOR 200 series. The devices that were announced are the HONOR 200 and HONOR 200 Pro . HONOR announced the two phones in China, as this is their initial launch. Both are expected to launch globally too, though. The HONOR 200 series is official, and the phones are coming to global markets Chances are that both smartphones will be identical globally, but with different software, of course. So this initial launch does reveal all the detail that you may be wondering about. If you take a look at the two devices below, you’ll see that they’re similar, but also different. You can easily tell which is which by their display holes. The HONOR 200 has a display camera hole, while the HONOR 200 Pro has a pill-shaped cutout on the display. Everything else is very similar, though. They both have curved displays with very thin bezels. There’s also an oval camera island on the back, in the top-left corner. Their backplates are rounded at the very edges. In regards to specs, these are mid-range phones, but very powerful mid-range phones... especially the HONOR 200 Pro. Let’s talk about that device first, shall we? The HONOR 200 Pro is fueled by the Snapdragon 8s Gen 3 SoC The HONOR 200 Pro includes a 6.78-inch 2700 x 1224 OLED display with a 120Hz refresh rate. That’s an OLED panel, by the way, and it gets immensely bright. It also offers a 3,840Hz high-frequency PWM dimming. The Snapdragon 8s Gen 3 fuels this smartphone, while HONOR offers 12GB and 16GB LPDDR5 RAM variants. Those two models come with 512GB and 1TB of non-expandable storage. It supports 100W wired and 66W wireless charging A 5,200mAh battery is included in the package, and the phone supports 100W wired charging. It also supports 66W wireless charging. Android 14 comes pre-installed with MagicOS 8.0 on top of it. A 50-megapixel main camera (OmniVision OV50H sensor, f/1.9 aperture, OIS), is backed with a 12-megapixel ultrawide camera (112-degree FOV, 2.5cm macro camera), and a 50-megapixel telephoto unit (Sony’s IMX856 sensor, 2.5x optical zoom, OIS). An in-display fingerprint scanner is also a part of the package. The phone also includes a set of stereo speakers, and Bluetooth 5.3. It measures 163.3 x 75.2 x 8.2mm and weighs 199 grams. The HONOR 200 Pro’s pricing starts at CNY3,499 ($483) in China. The HONOR 200 has a 120Hz display & Snapdragon 7 Gen 3 chip The vanilla HONOR 200, on the flip side, has a 6.7-inch 2664 x 1200 OLED display. That panel is also curved, and it also has a 120Hz refresh rate. It gets just as bright as the HONOR 200 Pro panel, and it has the same 3,840Hz high-frequency PWM dimming. The Snapdragon 7 Gen 3 fuels this smartphone, while both 12GB and 16GB LPDDR5 RAM models are available. Those two variants include 256GB and 512GB of internal storage, respectively. A 5,200mAh battery is included, and 100W wired charging supported A 5,200mAh battery sits inside this phone, and the device supports 100W wired charging. Android 14 comes pre-installed, along with MagicOS 8.0. This handset also includes an in-display fingerprint scanner and a set of stereo speakers. A 50-megapixel main camera (Sony’s IMX906 sensor, f/1.95 aperture, OIS) is backed by a 12-megapixel ultrawide unit (112-degree FOV, 2.5cm macro option), and a 50-megapixel telephoto camera (Sony’s IM856 sensor, 2.5x optical zoom, OIS). The HONOR 200 measures 161.5 x 74.6 x 7.7mm, and it weighs 187 grams. Its pricing starts at CNY2,699 ($373) in China.

title: Gut health expert's warning over 'increasingly popular' supplement
creator: bristolpostnews@localworld.co.uk (Steven Smith)
description: Sea moss has benefits, but one expert said it needed to be treated with caution
content: A gut health expert has issued a warning about a popular supplement. Sea moss has gained in popularity due to its high fibre content. However, Chris Dubberley said there were "hidden dangers" of sea moss, particularly its iodine content. Chris has urged consumers to approach it with caution due to its potential implications for gut and thyroid health. Chris said: "Sea moss supplements are gaining popularity for their supposed health benefits. Although the high fibre content in sea moss could benefit digestion for some, too much may cause gastrointestinal discomfort, such as bloating and diarrhoea. "The iodine found in sea moss also poses some concern for gut health. Although it’s necessary for thyroid function, too much iodine can upset the balance of gut bacteria, leading to gastrointestinal problems, as well as - ironically - hypothyroidism. "Sea moss also includes prebiotics, which support gut health by growing helpful bacteria. However, too much prebiotic can worsen symptoms for those with certain gut conditions, such as irritable bowel syndrome (IBS). "Taking care of your gut health needs a personalised approach. Everyone has a unique digestive system with their own dietary likes, sensitivities, and health conditions. This is important to keep in mind when thinking about trying sea moss supplements. "Before picking sea moss supplements, be careful because the iodine content can vary greatly between products. It's important that these supplements have clear labels showing how much iodine they contain so people can make informed decisions about their health."

title: China to accelerate construction of intelligent coal mines
description: China vows to further accelerate the intelligent construction of coal mines in the country to promote the high-quality development of the coal industry, according to the National Energy Administration.
content: China vows to further accelerate the intelligent construction of coal mines in the country to promote the high-quality development of the coal industry, according to the National Energy Administration. The energy bureaus of all coal-producing provinces, coal industry management departments and relevant central enterprises should step up their efforts to promote the intelligence level of coal mines to a broader scope and to provide strong support for ensuring the safe and stable supply of coal and building a new energy system, it said in a notice on Monday. Production coal mines with an annual output of 3 million metric tons or more are encouraged to comprehensively promote the intelligent transformation of major production processes, it said. The administration also encourages companies and local energy bureaus to continuously improve the autonomous operation capability of production systems, including unmanned operations in fixed locations and the application of robots in hazardous and labor-intensive positions, it said.

title: China's former Olympic champion ready to swim after ban
description: China's former Olympic champion swimmer Sun Yang has reiterated his ambition of coming back to compete as strong as ever after his doping ban of over four years finished on Tuesday.
content: China's former Olympic champion swimmer Sun Yang has reiterated his ambition of coming back to compete as strong as ever after his doping ban of over four years finished on Tuesday. Sun, a former three-time freestyle Olympic champion, technically regained his eligibility to compete in an official race again on May 28 after completing a suspension of four years and three months, issued by the Court of Arbitration for Sport, that took effect from Feb 28, 2020. Sun, who turned 32 in December, said during an exclusive interview with ThePaper.cn that he's never given up on his athletic career throughout the tough years and he's ready to come back as a competitive swimmer again. "I'd decided four years ago (when the suspension was imposed) that I would not quit. Now I just hope to be back in the pool and to step back on the starting blocks again as soon as possible," Sun said during the interview. Sun's controversial doping case dated back to September 2018 when a dispute with testers from IDTM, a FINA-hired agency, over the authorization of a random out-of-competition drugs test at his residence in Hangzhou, Zhejiang province escalated into a physical confrontation. Swimming's world governing body World Aquatics (then known as FINA) ruled in January 2019 that Sun's refusal to cooperate was reasonable based on results of an independent panel's investigation that found the IDTM testers failed to show adequate proof of identification and authorization, as claimed by Sun. Two months later, the World Anti-Doping Agency appealed the FINA ruling to CAS, resulting in an 11-hour public hearing in November 2019 in Swiss city Montreux. There, a panel of three judges determined Sun was guilty and imposed the eight-year ban in February 2020. The Swiss supreme court set aside the ban in December of that year following a successful appeal by Sun's attorney that challenged the neutrality of Franco Frattini, chairman of the original CAS panel, who was deemed to display anti-China bias in comments posted by the Italian on social media. The second hearing, as required by the Swiss court, took place in May 2021 overseen by a new panel of judges, who found that Sun "had acted recklessly" when he refused to let anti-doping officials leave his home with a sample of his blood. Sun had repeatedly protested his innocence during the protracted legal dispute. He claimed that he refused to cooperate only after finding testers were operating without adequate ID proof and were taking photos of him without his permission during what was supposed to be a confidential procedure. The Lausanne-based CAS announced in June 2021 to reduce the initial eight-year ban into four years and three months, citing rule amendments that allow flexibility to assess the "entirety of the circumstances". "At the beginning (of the suspension), I suffered a lot emotionally and mentally, feeling nothing but darkness. My parents almost tried to satisfy every one of my demands at that moment, worrying that I would suffer a mental problem," Sun confessed. "Then slowly and gradually, I managed to come out of the shadows, learned to appreciate and enjoy other things in my life, got married, went back to university to continue my academic studies. "Looking back now, I feel I've gained a lot more than what I've lost during the four years. "Now I've left it all behind, made peace with what happened in the past and am ready to give it a go again," said Sun, who won two gold medals (400m and 1,500m free) at London 2012, followed by a 200m gold at Rio 2016.

title: China Eastern Airlines receives sixth C919, as the jet marks 1st anniversary of commercial operation
description: China Eastern Airlines on Tuesday took delivery of its sixth C919 jet, as the domestically developed large passenger aircraft celebrates the 1st anniversary of commercial operations.
content: China Eastern Airlines on Tuesday took delivery of its sixth C919 jet, as the domestically developed large passenger aircraft celebrates the 1st anniversary of commercial operations. C919 jets have reportedly carried nearly 300,000 passengers during the past 12 months, accumulating over 6,000 incident-free flight hours, achieving preliminary success in commercial operations. Industry analysts said the mass production and delivery of C919s is advancing steadily, projecting Chinese aircraft manufacturers may reach the same level as international industry leaders by 2035, in terms of aircraft production capacity and technical support and maintenance. On Tuesday morning, a C919 aircraft numbered B-919G departed from Shanghai Pudong International Airport and landed at Shanghai Hongqiao International Airport shortly. The plane formally joined China Eastern Airlines' fleet, according to a press release the airliner sent to the Global Times. This is the first of a purchase order of 100 C919s that China Eastern Airlines signed with Commercial Aircraft Corporation of China (COMAC) in September 2023, the company said. Since the C919's inaugural commercial flight on May 28, 2023, its commercial operation has picked up speed. Over the past year, the aircraft began flying routes between Shanghai and Beijing, operating across the Chinese Lunar New Year travel rush and debuted at the Singapore Airshow. A chartered flight from Hong Kong to Shanghai is scheduled for Jun 1, which will mark C919's first overseas commercial flight, according to China Eastern Airlines. Analysts said large-scale operation of C919s is significant to promote China's competitiveness in the global aviation market. "Over the past year, C919's commercial operations made notable progress, carrying a large number of passengers and conducting test flights on more routes. Especially, the aircraft's debut at the Singapore Airshow underlies COMAC's resolve in exploring international markets," Wang Yanan, chief editor of Beijing-based Aerospace Knowledge magazine, told the Global Times on Tuesday. In addition to China Eastern Airlines, other major domestic carriers such as Air China and China Southern Airlines have also announced purchase of C919s from COMAC. To date, global orders of C919 have exceeded 1,000 aircraft, Xinhua News Agency reported. "Currently, C919 has sufficient orders while the C929 project has begun, which points to the sound development of the country's air transport and aircraft manufacturing sector," Qi Qi, an independent market analyst, told the Global Times on Tuesday. Qi calls for the accelerated development of aircraft industrial and supply chains domestically, especially stable supply such as engines and avionics, in a bid to boost the mass production of C919 jets. COMAC Deputy General Manager Qi Xuefeng said in November 2023 that the C929 aircraft has entered its detailed design stage. The manufacturing of large aircraft should give play to the activity of domestic and foreign suppliers, but we should strive to achieve a safe and self-controllable industrial and supply chain at the most for the mass production of every aircraft model, Qi said. It's expected that Chinese aircraft manufacturers will reach the same level as international giants such as Boeing and Aircraft as early as 2035 in terms of output, technical support and maintenance, Wang said. He said the progress made by the C919 is a vivid display of China's fruitful results in high-end manufacturing, and the continuing momentum will help the country retain its leading position in global competition. China has demonstrated its strong momentum and broad prospects in the development of new quality productive forces. China's first domestically produced large cruise ship, Adora Magic City, started commercial operations in January this year, another showcase of the country's manufacturing prowess.

title: Australian offshore energy storage project undertaken by Chinese company starts construction
description: The EPC project of Templers energy storage offshore in South Australia, contracted by China Energy Engineering Group's Shanxi Electric Power Construction Company commenced on Friday, according to the company.
content: (ECNS) -- The Engineering Procurement Construction ( EPC) project of Templers energy storage offshore in South Australia, contracted by China Energy Engineering Group's Shanxi Electric Power Construction Company commenced on Friday, according to the company. With a total construction capacity of 138 megawatts/330 megawatt hours, it is the company's first energy storage project in the Australian market. China Energy Engineering Group has gradually expanded into Australia's clean energy and storage industry and has signed a series of cooperation agreements with local developers, including ZEN Energy. Upon completion, the project will fully utilize the abundant local solar resources to stably deliver clean electricity. It holds significant importance for enhancing local grid security, improving the energy structure, reducing carbon emissions, and promoting the sustainable development of a green economy.

title: AP EAMCET 2024 rank list soon at cets.apsche.ap.gov.in/EAPCET; check response sheet here
creator: Arpita Das
description: The AP EAMCET 2024 rank card will be released on May 28. Candidates can download their AP EAMCET 2024 rank card using the registration number, hall ticket number and date of birth.
content: The AP EAMCET 2024 rank card will be released on May 28. Candidates can download their AP EAMCET 2024 rank card using the registration number, hall ticket number and date of birth. New Delhi: The Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University (JNTU) Kakinada will declare the AP EAMCET 2024 result soon. Along with the result, the AP EAMCET rank list will also be made available. The AP EAPCET result link will be activated on the official website, cets.apsche.ap.gov.in/EAPCET, once it is out. To check the result and download the AP EAMCET 2024 rank list, the hall ticket and registration number will be required. Those candidates whose names will be on the rank list will have to participate in the Andhra EAPCET counselling round. AP EAMCET Rank List 2024 The exam conducting authority will release the AP EAMCET 2024 rank list along with the result. The AP EAMCET 2024 (Engineering, Agriculture & Pharmacy Common Entrance Test) will now have 100 per cent weightage on the marks secured in the exam for determining overall rankings for admissions into professional courses this year. Previously, rankings were based on a combination of AP EAMCET normalized marks (75 per cent weightage) and Class 12 marks (25 per cent weightage) in the order of merit. AP EAMCET Response Sheet 2024 The AP EAMCET 2024 response sheet for Engineering was released on May 24 along with the answer key. Candidates who appeared for the exam can download the AP EAPCET response sheet 2024 using the EAPCET hall ticket number, registration number and date of birth. The response sheet indicates the responses selected by candidates during the entrance exam. How to download the AP EAMCET 2024 response sheet?
